titlestmt.titleproper: Ford Foundation records, Papers of the Select Committee on the Future of Private and Independent Higher Education in the State of New York
A Guide to the Ford Foundation records, Papers of the Select Committee on the Future of Private and Independent Higher Education in the State of New York FA707
titlestmt.author: Arranged and described by Nancy Weltchek, Ford Foundation Archives

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2021-01-30 00:31:41 -0500.

did.unittitle: Ford Foundation records, Papers of the Select Committee on the Future of Private and Independent Higher Education in the State of New York

bioghist.head: History of the Committee
bioghist.p: In March 1967, Governor Nelson Rockefeller and Chancellor Edgar W. Couper of the New York Board of Regents, jointly appointed a Select Committee on the Future of Private and Independent Higher Education in New York State. The members of the Committee were: McGeorge Bundy, Chairman, Dr. James Conant, Dr. John Hannah, The Reverend Theodore M. Hesburgh, and Dr. Abram Sachar.

The purpose of the Committee was to determine the role of government in private higher education, and to advise the Governor and the Board of Regents on how the State could fund private institutions without jeopardizing their independent status. A final report recommending that government be active in strengthening statewide educational planning and in providing financial assistance to private higher education was made public in January 1968.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This is not a complete collection of all materials relating to the Select Committee on the Future of Private and Independent Higher Education in New York State, but rather those papers retained by George Griffiths and sent along with his office files to the Ford Foundation Archives. Mr. Griffiths, a Ford Foundation Program Officer in Public Education, was not a formal member of the Committee, but was involved in its day-to-day activity.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The papers are divided into three series:

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Ford Foundation archive was deposited at RAC in 2011. Ford Foundation records, correspondence, reports, program files and officers papers were transferred to, and accessioned by, RAC beginning in 2011. Accessions continue as necessary.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Records more than 10 years old are open for research with select materials restricted as noted. Brittle or damaged items are available at the discretion of RAC.

did.unittitle: Correspondence

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The correspondence is divided into two sections: correspondence between Bundy and educators - primarily university presidents - and between Bundy and Governor Rockefeller. Both sections are in reverse chronological order. The first covers the period from January 1968 to April 1967, and the second from February 1968 to February 1967.

did.unittitle: Bundy with university presidents
Bundy with university presidents

Bundy with university presidents
Bundy with university presidents
Bundy with university presidents
Bundy/Rockefeller
Staff Papers

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The staff papers, in reverse chronological order from January 1968 to March 1967, reflect some of the day-to-day activities of the Committee and include correspondence, inter-office memoranda, minutes of meetings, interim reports, a first draft of the completed report, and partial rewrites of it.

Reports

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: After the first report (New York State and Private Higher Education: Report of the Select Committee on the Future of Private and Independent Higher Education in New York State/1968), the remainder of this series is arranged alphabetically by report title.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The reports sections consists of a variety of reports on relevant topics written by financial and educational consultants, universities, the New York State Education Department, etc..., and the final report of the Committee, "New York State and Private Higher Education: Report of the Select Committee on the Future of Private and Independent Higher Education in New York State/1968."
